meanings.sent1: He was caught gypping in the card game.
meanings.sent2: She accused him of gypping her out of her money.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked that he was gypping the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The scam artist was gypping unsuspecting victims with his fake investment scheme.
meanings.sent5: The sneaky fox was gypping the other animals by stealing their food.

meanings.sent1: The con artist was gypping people with his fake lottery tickets.
meanings.sent2: She realized too late that he had been gypping her all along.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun was gypping travelers with his illusions.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a mask, gypping everyone into believing she was happy.
meanings.sent5: The clever detective caught the criminal gypping the shop owner with counterfeit money.

meanings.sent1: The salesman was gypping unsuspecting customers with overpriced products.
meanings.sent2: He felt guilty for gypping his friend into doing all the work.
meanings.sent3: The greedy landlord was gypping tenants by charging exorbitant rent.
meanings.sent4: The cunning fox was gypping the rabbit by pretending to be its friend.
meanings.sent5: The dishonest mechanic was gypping customers by recommending unnecessary repairs.

meanings.sent1: The corrupt politician was gypping the public with false promises.
meanings.sent2: She regretted gypping her way out of trouble instead of being honest.
meanings.sent3: The sly cat was gypping the birds by pretending to be harmless.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds were gypping the sun of its chance to shine.
meanings.sent5: The shady businessman was gypping investors by manipulating the stock market.
